items.headline: Israel eliminates Hamas operative behind deadly 2004 Beersheba bus bombings â€” long-sought target taken out in precision strike.
Netanyahu departs for diplomatic meetings as West Bank development plans draw international commentary. Administration clarifies position on sovereignty steps.
October 7 commemoration bill moves through Knesset â€” debate over official naming convention continues among bereaved families and lawmakers.
President Herzog visits Australia â€” first Israeli presidential visit, strengthening bilateral ties in Canberra.

Trump administration set to revoke Obama-era EPA 'endangerment finding' on CO2 this week â€” removes legal foundation for federal emissions regulations, returning energy policy to market-driven approach.
Top immigration officials defend enforcement priorities in congressional hearing â€” border crossings remain at multi-year lows as deportation operations continue.
Google expands 'Results About You' tool to cover government IDs â€” users can now request removal of driver's licenses, passports, and SSNs from search results.
US forces in Qatar load missile launchers amid Iran tensions â€” satellite imagery shows military readiness posture in the Gulf.
Alphabet raises $20B in bonds to fund AI data center buildout â€” plans to double capex to $185B in 2026, signaling massive infrastructure commitment.
OpenAI updates privacy policy â€” review notification received. Worth scanning for any data handling changes that affect your workflows.
Sarvam AI launches India-first AI platform positioning against Gemini and ChatGPT â€” focused on local language APIs for the Indian market.
AI data privacy emerging as C-suite priority â€” new analysis warns that deletion and control are harder than expected in production AI systems.
